title: Thank you for fixing the carousel!
body: Having been involved from the start of TFT, I've read through dozens upon dozens of discussions about the LL hitboxes, closeness of champs in the carousel, and so forth.  I can honestly say: the current state is great.  Thanks Riot!

replies.body:
They spread out the champions so that there's a gap between them; there used to be none.

They made it so you have to walk over the center of the champion to pick them up; you used to pick them up by barely scraping the edge.

They made the bodyblock about 1/4 what is used to be; It used to be super easy to entirely divert someone, but now is only effective if your centers are bumping.

> [{quoted}](name=Porglit,realm=NA,application-id=RaE1aOE7,discussion-id=ZB4tTrk3,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-07-29T13:35:29.020+0000)
>
> Having been involved from the start of TFT, I've read through dozens upon dozens of discussions about the LL hitboxes, closeness of champs in the carousel, and so forth.  I can honestly say: the current state is great.  Thanks Riot!

What changes exactly?

The little legends still body-block you like they always have and the carousel is spaced exactly as it has been as of 10 minutes ago.

There is nothing on the test server notes either.

The entire thing is just as annoying as always....
